oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 07 d
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 07 d. Newspaper clipping: 'Knoxville's Lady Senator.' Knoxville Journal Tribune. December 31, 1922. Includes photograph of James and Lizzie Crozier, cut by Knoxville Engraving Co.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Portraits; Children;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: KNOXVILLE'S LADY SENATOR Little Lizzie Crozier (Mrs. L. Crozier French) and her brother James, as they appeared several years ago. Mrs. French is one of Knoxville's most prominent clubwomen and received the endorsement of practically all clubs for a seat in the United States senate in event a vacancy should (missing)
